forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Showers and thunderstorms before 7pm, then rain. Partly cloudy. Low around 44, with temperatures rising to around 46 overnight. Northwest wind 5 to 21 mph, with gusts as high as 26 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New rainfall amounts between a quarter and half of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Wednesday
forecast.shortForecast: Slight Chance Light Rain then Sunny
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of rain before 10am. Sunny. High near 54, with temperatures falling to around 52 in the afternoon. South wind 3 to 7 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As twilight deepens over Downtown San Francisco, the scent of rain hangs heavily in the air, a promise unfulfilled as the clouds thicken and drench the city in a fresh chill. Pouring before nightfall, showers and the faint rumble of distant thunder make the streets glisten beneath the dim light, while gusts swirl with a brisk energy that rustle leaves and scatter the last remnants of the day’s warmth. The evening air cools to a low of around 44 degrees, sharpening the corners of buildings and deepening shadows; temperatures will embrace slightly warmer tones overnight. 

Tomorrow, a sense of hope emerges as rain gives way to sunshine. The forecast hints at a delicate dance of clouds yielding to golden rays, a slight chance of morning drizzle giving the city a chance to dry off and breathe. As the day unfolds, temperatures will peak with quiet confidence near 54 degrees before slipping gently back into the cool embrace of afternoon. For those headed outside, dressing in layers will offer comfort against the lingering bite of winter, with a sturdy coat and perhaps a touch of brightness to ward off the gray. Take a quiet stroll through the streets or nestle into a cozy café, savoring a warm drink and the serene moments of the afternoon, as San Francisco sheds its rain-soaked veil for just a while.
